subject: Thank you for banking with us...Yours In service..
body:
WASHINGTON TRUST BANK
Address: 717 West Sprague Avenue Spokane, WA USA
Contact Person: Mr. Peter F. Stanton,Chairman and CEO
Washington Trust Bank, Payment officer

Dear:  Laura,
I received your message.
See attached your Update statement of Account and your Fund Approval
Notification ...This is your long Inheritance  Contract payment from
 Government  but the Government in power then  refused to release it to you
for past years  but thanks God for current Government that Re- Approved
your payment and instructed our bank to  release your $200 million without
any more postponement as soon as  you secure the needed ....I am here to
inform  you that the investor said that she can only loan anybody that
leaves and work here in United States so if you're not here please dont
register the name as I have talk to the waiver departments and they
accepted that you should apply for waiver with $1,999.00 only to enable
United States Government waive the taxation fees on your behalf and release
 your Tax Clearance Certificate before i will transfer your $200 million to
your nominated bank account or send it to you via Master Atm card or open
an online bank account in your name and transfer your $200 million as soon
as you apply for the waiver with $1,999.00 Only .....Get back to advise you
how you will send it to the waiver department and receive your $200
million...Thank you for banking with us...Yours In service...
Mr. Peter F. Stanton
Chairman and CEO
Washington Trust Bank.
Phone: +1 509 237 7090
Address: 717 West Sprague Avenue
Spokane, WA

subject: Re: Thank you for banking with us...Yours In service..
body:
Hello Mr. Peter F. Stanton,

Thank you for your message and the information provided. It's great to hear that the current government has approved my payment.

I'm a bit confused about some parts of your message though. Could you please clarify what you mean by "secure the needed here"? Also, could you explain more about this waiver? What exactly does it entail?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Laura
